https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674156.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
When I cook something new I always follow the exact recipe, then if I make it again I'll experiment. This recipe was good as it was very flavorful. I understand why some said it tasted too much like chili but we like that profile. The chicken was over cooked though and the sauce was too liquidy for my liking. Next time I will cut the chicken in strips first or use very thin breast filets. I will allow the sauce to thicken before adding the chicken back in and only simmer for a few minutes to cook the chicken. My husband wants more hot sauce (Tapatio) added, which I'll do. Flavor-wise my family really enjoyed this. We served with crusty bread one night and leftovers with rice. A big green salad would go well with this.

text:
I'm not a cook....really hate to cook....seriously.   But this was actually very easy and tasted phenomenal!  I made as directed but omitted the celery seed (I didn't have it, and don't like the taste of it anyway).  I omitted the salt as well, because I think there is plenty of salt already in the worcestershire sauce.  I also DOUBLED the recipe, as I wanted to have sauce for the rice I served with it.  I also used chicken broth instead of water, used 4 cloves of garlic (instead of 2 when the recipe is doubled).  I opted for all organic ingredients, which I think can make a difference in terms of taste.  My family loved it, and I would definitely make this again.  It's a keeper!

None
text:
This is a good, solid recipe. I didn't read the reviews before cooking, but did so after. I ended up doing some of the things others did, white wine vinegar, white wine instead of water, diced tomatoes instead of stewed, leaving out the teaspoon of salt. I use thighs instead of breasts so didn't have a dryness problem, but also only cooked 25 minutes.  This is an interesting combination of sweet, salty, spicy and tangy. I do think that onions would not be out of place in the sauce and would add another dimension to the flavors.  Also, I wish I would have added more hot sauce or some red pepper flakes for a little more of a kick.  Overall, a recipe that can be adapted to tastes and is easy to make.

text:
This sauce is amazing. I tweeked it a bit to turn it into one of the best chipotle sauces I have ever tasted. I diced up my stewed tomatoes and only added one Tbspn of brown sugar, I also omitted the celery seed. Then I added about 4 adobe chipotle peppers in sauce, from a can, and there you have it authentic chipotle sauce that goes great over chicken or mixed in rice. My husband was both satisfied and impressed!

text:
My husband said "this is a keeper recipe".   I asked him what rating and he said very high, which is why I gave it 5 stars.    

The only minor change I made was substituting 1 T olive oil for one of the tablespoons of butter, so it would have a higher smoke point for cooking.   I tend to use too high of a temp for butter.

I wouldn't change a thing in the spices or quantities as we felt that the sauce was nicely balanced.   I served it over jasmine rice with a side of broccoli.

I made this recipe last night, and we all loved it. city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this dish last night on a whim and I'm so glad I did! It was absolutely delicious! My boyfriend was so impressed and asked me to make this again sometime! He's the fussiest eater, and he hasn't said that about anything else I've experimented with. The flavors were wonderful, the chicken was so juicy and tender! I made a couple changes to the recipe based on other reviews. Instead of using water I used red cooking wine, and also substituted the vinegar for white cooking wine. I used only 1 tsp of chili powder, instead of 2. I'm glad I did otherwise I think it would have overpowered the other flavors. I also used a can of organic diced tomatoes instead of stewed. I didn't have any celery seed on hand, so I substituted with celery salt. I added red onion cut in rounds once the sauce came to a boil, replaced the chicken, and added the rest of the onion on top and around the chicken. It smelled fantastic while it was cooking! I made a cheesy hash brown casserole as a side, however the flavors were too rich together. In the future I'll probably opt for a green bean or asparagus side dish, and maybe saffron rice. I will definitely be making this dish throughout the years to come!!

city:

country:
None
text:
Quite tasty & even my picky kids liked it!  Changes were based on other reviews & ingredient availability: 1) Subbed fire roasted diced tomatoes for stewed. 2) subbed Teriyaki sauce for half of the Worcestershire required because I ran out 3) Reduced fat by browning chicken using a light drizzle of olive oil in electric skillet instead of frying in butter on stovetop 4) Omitted hot sauce & let it be added at the table, as my kids don't like spicy-hot food.  5) Subbed Splenda brown sugar, using half the recommended amount.  6) doubled the sauce to chicken ratio, as it boils down quite a bit.  Very moist, flavorful chicken dish that was a pleasant break from the same-old routine.  Try this one, you will like it!

userID:
4702096
Display Name:
outstndn
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677174.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was an awesome recipe! I had every ingredient with the exception of the brown sugar.  

I read through the reviews, which is always helpful, prior to cooking it up to look for any tips or suggestions that would sound good.  I did read one review that stated they substituted the brown sugar with honey, which was so clever, especially since I didn't have any brown sugar on hand.  I also, don't care for stew tomatoes as I'm not a fan of large chunks of tomatoes in any of my dishes, I rather prefer to have small pieces so that there is a piece of tomato in every bite, so I opted for a can of diced tomatoes.

Since chicken breasts, have the issue of being thick on one side and slender on another, I decided to slice three chicken breasts in half lengthwise, to get a thinner cut of chicken breasts so that they would cook evenly and so I would also have the six pieces as is suggested with the original recipe.  I paired the chicken recipe with rice, and cooked the rice in a little bit of chicken broth, smothered the Chicken Pierre over the rice on each persons plate and added a side of broccoli to finish the plates, and the family loved it! 

There was just a hint of spice, as the honey was a nice pairing in the recipe to give it a good balance.  My 2 year old even loved it! That should tell you, that its really not that spicy.  This will be included in my rotation. :)

text:
This was fantastic. I made 3 minor changes as follows: sub'd 1/2 C red wine for the water, decreased chilli powder to 1 teaspoon and when I turned my chicken over to brown the other side I slice an onion ontop of the breasts. When the chicken was done I took the breasts out, left the onion and added the rest of the ingredients. I served this with my orzo/rice that I make. For that, I brown 1/3 cup of each rice and orzo in two tablespoons of butter, when slightly brown I add a carton of chicken stock and simmer until done. This makes a fast and yummy meal, Thanks for sharing!

text:
Delicious! I had 2 large chicken breasts. I didn't have stewed tomatoes so I used an 8 oz can of tomato sauce and 1 1/2 tomatoes I scrounged up from the plant and freezer. I didn't have worcestershire, threw in 1 Tbsp of steak sauce for the heck of it. No celery seed either. I used a little oil in my skillet and just 1 Tbs of butter. I also threw in some frozen yellow pepper strips to up the vegetable consumption.  This was barely enough sauce for my 2 large (chicken) breasts. I didn't add any hot pepper sauce, wasn't sure what it was and my daughter can't handle too much spiciness. Very yummy.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674155.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great recipe - had all ingredients on hand!  

My changes based on family preferences (there is nothing wrong with this recipe as written, however). --  1.  Quadrupled the breading mix because I wanted a good crispy coating (used more margarine when sauteeing because of this); 2.  Cut chicken breasts into wide strips (cooks faster and browns easily); 3.  Used almost a whole 28 oz. can of diced tomatoes (pureed them somewhat with my immersion blender because kids think they don't like tomatoes); 4.  Substituted red wine vinegar for white distilled vinegar.  5.  Kept chicken warm in oven while assembling sauce.  6.  Only simmered the chicken/sauce about 15-20 minutes instead of 25-40 minutes (because the chicken was already done).

It ended up looking like Chinese food - similar in appearance to hot braised boneless chicken with red chili sauce.  However, Chicken Pierre tastes less spicy and much fresher, and no msg!  Very kid and parent-friendly.

It was so easy to make and fast, I made a few adjustments after reading  suggestions.  I chopped onions the more the better if you like it with onions  ( circles ) for a couple of minutes and then added 1/2 cup of white wine  for 3 minutes .  and then added the canned tomatoes,sugar and spices. and at the last maybe 5 minutes i added sliced mushrooms !!! If you want more of sauce just add chicken stock or water and then to thicken it up corn starch to cold water and add at the end depending how thick you like it.  salt and pepper to your taste.

ETA: I think next time I make this, I am going to skip the flouring. I think it gives a tiny bit of a slimy texture to the chicken in the finished dish (not a huge issue, but I won't miss it). text:
This was "OK." I made half the recipe for my bf and I this past Saturday. My friend made this for me a while ago, and I thought it was good. I kept in my recipe box so that I could make it myself sometime. Either my memory of this dish is inaccurate or my tastes have changed because I didn't care for this very much at all (and neither did my bf)....  I followed Nancy's directions to a T, except for halving the recipe, keeping the sauce proportions for 6 servings and subbing Italian stewed tomatoes for plain ones. At the last minute, I noticed that I only had two chicken breasts, but everything else was to scale. I followed Shoangore's suggestion to serve each breast over spaghetti with a lemon slice and fresh parsley sprig for garnish. I steamed some fresh asparagus to serve on the side. French bread completed the meal (we dunked slices in the remaining sauce). This was satisfying, but not something that I'd make again (the bf agrees). My bf thinks this is similar to braised balsamic chicken by MOONANDBACK, but I disagree - that recipe is much better!!! Thanks anyways!

This was one of the best chicken recipes I have tried in a long time.  I did follow a couple suggestions from reviewers.  I did use chicken broth instead of water and I also very quickly sauted some red onion in the pan before cooking the sauce.  Just long enough for them to soften a little.  Next time I make this I will also double the recipe for the sauce.  I served it over rice and my husband and I like extra sauce when eating rice.  If I made this for company, I think I might even triple the recipe.  Thank you for posting this!  This was very delicious!

Wow!  This was really tasty, just enough tang to make it truly unique.  I just did a couple of things differently, my husband and I are not fans of tomato chunks so I liquified the canned tomatoes in the blender (there was no need to add the water that was called for as this made it liquidy enough).  I also added a splash of white wine.  The Chicken was soooo tender in here, oh and I added Mushroom.  I will definitely make this one again i'm just trying to think how I might be able to thiken it up a little.  I'm even considering adding this with my reg sauce next time I make a lasagna just to give it a different taste.  Thanks for the Recipe!

this was so good.  i thought maybe even worth 5 stars but polling the family the all said 4-4.5 this is the second time i have tried something from this site.  and i will continue to use it.  i did change a little bit when making the recipe,  i used half distilled vinegar and half basalmic. and i cut the chili powder in half.  i also let he chicken sit in the sauce for about 3 hours. after it was done and then just rewarmed it for dinner.  i think it added to the flavor the longer it " stewed "  i will be making this again, thankyou for the recipe.

text:
Considering I used this recipe purely because I had all the ingredients on hand, I was shocked at how incredible it was! I used only 3 ck breasts halves, and the sauce was just enough; I would have to double the sauce for more chicken. I only needed to cook the ck with the sauce an additional 15 minutes, or so. Only major change was using red wine rather than water, as a review suggested. Thanks for this easy, delish recipe!

text:
I have been cooking this recipe for almost a year now. And I have tweaked it to my families prefs.  I add a small amount of chopped garlic to the butter for browning(about 4 min. on both sides)adds nice flavor! I use two cans of italian stewed tomatoes( my husband prefers thinner sauce for dipping). I use red wine vinegar. Simmer for 20 min. and the chicken comes out great every time. I have 4 boys so a timer is a must.  Everything else is the same, and it is a favorite!

text:
I absolutely LOVED this!!! (I'm going to give it 5 stars even though I did play around with the seasonings until the sauce was how I liked it) As usual, I cut the chicken into bite-size pieces and browned them in olive oil, then added some finely chopped onion. I was a bit leery of the vinegar, but it truly made all the difference. I also added some canned tomato sauce little by little as the sauce reduced and needed more liquid. I served it over angel hair pasta. Delicious! Thanks so much, Nancy!

Display Name:
ALBIANNE
isPro:

72
favoritesCount:

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674157.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Really tasty.  I ended up using 1 tsp each of celery salt and garlic powder (personal preference) and used a large can of crushed tomatoes (the kids won't eat lumps of tomato).  When the chicken had finished cooking in the sauce I removed the chicken to a plate and whisked in 1/2 cup of heavy cream then stirred in approx 4 cups of macaroni that had already been cooked and then layed the chicken on the top.  It had a delicious creamy tomato taste with just enough zing.  I served it with a green salad and it made a great meal.  I used a total of 4 medium-large skinless boneless breasts which I cut into 4 chunks each.  I will probably skip the flour coating next time and just saute the chicken quickly in the butter without it, maybe the flour helps to thicken the sauce if you are just using stewed tomato's but the crushed tomato's mixed later with the cream made for a perfect consistency (no need to thicken).  This is a keeper.  Thanks for sharing Nancy.
Review:
Rating:
4

text:
Excellent! Based on some of the previous reviews I was afraid this may be a bit too spicy, so I only used 1/2 of the chili powder and no pepper sauce. 5 minutes before serving I tasted sauce and it was bland so I added the pepper sauce and the rest of the chili powder.  It was delicious! I did not find it too spicy at all. My husband and son loved it too! Don't let the barbeque smell while it's cooking fool you --- this doesnot taste like bbq chicken.  Thanks!

I was a little nervous about trying this recipe.  There are so many rave reviews, but those who didn't like it, REALLY didn't like it.  I was pleasantly surprised to fall into the majority who enjoyed the dish!  I didn't have celery seed or dry mustard, and used diced tomatoes instead of stewed.  Very tasty!  It does have a hint of BBQ flavor, but was much more complex.  I will definitely try again, and I'm looking forward to seeing how the celery seed and mustard add to the flavors.

This is a fantastic recipe.  Like most I altered it slightly for our personal tastes, but this gave me the perfect base.  I used a can of diced tomatoes undrained, used a red wine instead of water, balsamic vinegar instead of white and added fresh mushrooms. My hubby has always been suspicious of chicken recipes with "tomato" stuff, but he actually went back for more sauce to go with his chicken this time!  Next time I think I'll make it two cans of diced tomatoes! ;) Thanks for a great idea.
